channel.title: Problem With Compiling
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i890.photobucket.com/albums/ac104/lazyness_net/wdid.jpg[/img]
Ok so I'm going to assume that *.java is saying that all files within the bin that have a file name ending in .java are being called as * is the wildcard. Either way, it is not reading. I have my path set to
[code]@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause[/code]
[code]PATH (SYSTEM): C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\;[/code]
[code]CLASSPATH (OWNER): CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
[code]CLASSPATH (SYSTEM): CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
My path to the java bin is obviously C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin.
Any ideas on how to fix this?

item.title: Problem With Compiling
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:5, topic:379460”]1. Did you put the variables for the java path?
2. Did you change the version of the java to yours and is the location correct of where java is in the compiler code? Same for variables.[/quote]

My PATHs and CLASSPATHs are both set to direct to the JDK bin and everything. I’ve changed it to the correct version in the compiler and the location is correct. Not sure of the variables. I’ll try updating Java and I’ll see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem With Compiling
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

  1. Did you put the variables for the java path?
  2. Did you change the version of the java to yours and is the location correct of where java is in the compiler code? Same for variables.

item.title: Problem With Compiling
item.dc:creator: @Lazyness Lazyness
item.description:
@Lazyness wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:2, topic:379460”]try “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java? just change teh java version

or is it delta?[/quote]

I’ll give that a try. It’s PI.

Edit: I get the same message.

Read full topic
